Text.val: Opens .CSV file PI.PATHFILE in Excel via OLE automation
ANSI, UTF-16LE and UTF-8 files can be opened with Excel (2003 and later) without problems
If the program finds that a different encoding is used, it will convert PI:PATHFILE to UTF-8 before opening
04.06.2013 AS SCR#18187, implemented workaround for probelm with thousand seperator in Poland
Excel hat instantiation set to automatic and is already running in the background (invisible)
TODO: Call Message Box programs with existing error codes
Note: There's a problem with Excel (v2003) and Workbooks.OpenText method if the file extension is .csv
Excel then simply won't open the file in most cases. As workaround we do copy the file to
a temporary file with extension .txt in this case
Peek into file to see if it has a BOM ...
ANSI, UTF-8 and UTF-16LE get opened by Excel without problems
If the character set is different we convert the file to UTF-8 first
Invoke Excel Method Workbooks.OpenText to open the file
command to open files with unknown codepage (Most likely ANSI) ...
Set Excel which is running in background to Visible ...
